knimeNode.name: Top k Selector
knimeNode.shortDescription: Selects the top k rows according to user-defined criteria.

fullDescription.intro: The node behaves the same as a combination of the Sorter node followed by a Row Filter that only keeps the first k rows of the table except for the order of the rows which depends on the Output order settings. Note, however, that the implementation of this node is more efficient then the node combination above. In the dialog, select the columns according to which the data should be selected. For each column you can also specify whether a larger or smaller value is considered as superior.
fullDescription.option: If you want to extend the selection criteria to a higher number of columns as displayed, set the number of columns at the bottom and click 'new columns' to add them to the dialog.
The number of rows to select from the input table.

option.name: Move Missing Cells to end of sorted list

fullDescription.option: If selected, missing values are always considered to be inferior to present cells.

Specifies constraints of the order of the output
No order: No specific order is required for the rows in the output. This is the best option in terms of runtime.
Retain order: Ensures that the rows in the output are the same as in the input.
Sort output: The rows in the output are sorted according to the specified criteria.

Specifies the mode for the top K selection of the output
Top K rows: Returns the top K rows based on their first occurrence in the input table.
Top K rows with unique values: Returns all occurrences of the top K rows.

ports.outPort: A table containing the top k rows.
